bibl.title: Letter from Hideyo Noguchi to R.B. Howland, October 30, 1922

div1.p: Noguchi thanks Howland for Comstock's letter and comments on the fever cases in Brazil.

div1.head: Letter from Hideyo Noguchi to R.B. Howland, October 30, 1922
div1.opener:
Copy
THE ROCKEFELLER
INSTITUTE FOR MEDICAL RESEARCH
October 30, 1922
Dear Mr. Howland:
div1.p:
Thank you very much for letting me have a copy
of Mr. Comstock's interesting letter. Some of the cases re-
ported certainly do not sound like yellow fever, and I suspect
they were the pneumonic form of bubonic plague.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, (Signed) Hideyo Noguchi MR. R. B. Howland
Dwight P. Robinson and Co.
125 East 46th Street
New York, N. Y.
